tasks: Create a simple wireframe of a login page using the 8-point grid system, focusing on proper alignment and spacing (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/8-point-grid-system).

Write down 3 usability heuristics for user interface design that you're familiar with from nngroup.com's article '10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design' and explain how they apply to your current work. (Reference: https://www.nngroup.com/articles/ten-usability-heuristics/).
Conduct a self-reflection exercise on your collaboration style, identifying 2 areas where you'd like to improve and making a plan to implement changes in the next week.
Redesign your portfolio's navigation using the 8-point grid system and create a visual design concept for it. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/8-point-grid-system).

Create a simple user flow diagram of a common UX process, such as onboarding or checkout, using the Zeigarnik Effect to guide your design decisions. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/zeigarnik-effect/).
Practice active listening by having a 10-minute conversation with someone from a different department and documenting 3 key takeaways about their perspective.
Design a simple error page using the Aesthetic-Usability Effect to guide your design decisions. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/aesthetic-usability-effect/).
Conduct 2 user interviews and document 5 pain points using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework, then create a simple wireframe of a solution to address one of those pain points.
Write a short reflection on how Tesler’s Law applies to your current work, identifying areas where you can improve the usability of your designs. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/teslers-law/).

Create a comprehensive design concept for a new product feature using all the UX Fundamentals and principles learned throughout this program, including the 8-point grid system, usability heuristics, and Tesler’s Law.
Develop a simple prototype of your design concept using a tool like Figma or Sketch, and test it with 2 users to gather feedback.
Write a final reflection on your journey as an Explorer-level designer, highlighting key takeaways and areas for continued improvement.

resources.readup: As an Explorer UX designer, you have the unique opportunity to shape the user experience of innovative products and services. To excel in this role, focus on developing a strong foundation in UX fundamentals, collaboration, and communication skills, while also exploring new design tools and techniques to enhance your UI craft and visual design capabilities.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Hick's Law and its Application in UX Design
topics.summary: Mastering Hick's Law will help you create more efficient and effective navigation systems, improving the overall user experience.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing websites using Hick's Law and provide recommendations for improvement (written report)
Create a heuristic evaluation guide based on Hick's Law and apply it to a new design project
Develop an interactive prototype demonstrating the impact of Hick's Law on user behavior

topics.name: Conducting User Research with the Zeigarnik Effect in Mind
topics.summary: Applying the Zeigarnik Effect to your research will help you uncover user pain points and create more effective solutions.
practice_points: Conduct 2 user interviews using the Zeigarnik Effect framework and document findings (written report)
Create a user persona based on research findings from at least 3 users
Develop an empathy map to understand user motivations and behaviors

topics.name: Designing for Proximity with Tesler's Law
topics.summary: Mastering Tesler's Law will help you create more intuitive and user-friendly interfaces, reducing cognitive load.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing websites using Tesler's Law and provide recommendations for improvement (written report)
Create a visual design system incorporating the principles of Tesler's Law
Develop an interactive prototype demonstrating the impact of Tesler's Law on user behavior
